context_of_use: This use case allows customers to checkout orders and track their status while enabling managers to approve orders.
stakeholders_and_interests: customer: wants to complete purchases efficiently
manager: wants to ensure timely order approvals
description: Covers checking out orders, tracking order status, and approving orders where required.
preconditions: Customer has items in the cart.
Customer is logged into the system.
postconditions: Order status is updated for tracking.
assumptions: Customer has a valid payment method.
Manager is available to approve orders.
requirements_met: The system shall allow customers to checkout using multiple payment methods.
The system shall enable customers to track their orders.
The system shall allow managers to approve orders.
outstanding_issues: Need to define the process for handling payment failures.
main_flow: 1. Customer selects payment method → System processes payment.
2. System confirms order and provides order summary → Customer receives confirmation.
3. Customer requests order tracking → System displays current order status.
4. Manager reviews pending orders → System presents orders for approval.
5. Manager approves order → System updates order status.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 1): If payment fails, System notifies customer and prompts for a different payment method.
